the terms of the
link:https://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl-3.0.html[GNU Lesser General
Public License] and link:https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html[GNU
General Public License] as published by the Free Software Foundation;
either version 3 of the Licenses, or (at your option) any later version.
The library itself is licensed under the LGPL while the sample
command-line applications and GUI binary gegl is licensed under the GPL.
GEGL depends on and ships with the
link:http://code.google.com/p/poly2tri-c[Poly2Tri-C] library, which is
also free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the
terms of the
link:https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause[New BSD License].
